infoIntro:
The “Minutes of the Federal Council (1848–1963)” page allows full-text searches of the handwritten minutes from 1848 to 1903 and the typewritten minutes up to 1963.

Text recognition for the handwritten minutes is based on the latest AI-supported processes. However, if you notice any errors, please let us know by e-mailing us at bundesratsprotokolle@bar.admin.ch. This will help us to improve our AI process.

We recommend using a laptop or tablet to consult the Federal Council minutes, but you can also access them via a smartphone. The “Minutes of the Federal Council (1848–1963)” page is barrier-free.
infoSimple:
To conduct a simple search on the start page, enter a term of your choice, which will then be searched for in all the minutes.

You can use the timeline to narrow your search down to a specific period.

There are a range of further options for advanced searches:
infoSimpleList:
• Term and phrase search (“word”; “this is a phrase”)
    Example: “Kanton Zürich”
  • Wildcard search: ? (a single character), * (multiple characters), ~ (fuzzy search)
    Examples: Z?rich, Zür*, Zürich~
  • Boolean operators: && (AND), || (OR), ! (NOT)
    Examples: Kanton && Bern, Bern || Zürich, Kanton !Stadt (also: Kanton AND Bern, Bern OR Zürich, Kanton NOT Stadt)
infoResult:
The results list displays the minutes in which the search term was found.

Click on the minutes to go to the first passage of text found within the selected minutes.
infoBrowserBeforeImage: The decision minutes are arranged in chronological order. Searching by date allows you to access a specific set of minutes easily.
infoBrowserAfterImage: [EN] Datum / Protokoll (> Mirador) / Signatur (> externer Button auf Online Zugang)
infoMirador:
You consult the minutes in the Archival IIIF Viewer (IIIF = International Image Interoperability Framework).

The viewer is based on the browser application from Mirador. It offers a range of functions to assist you:
infoMiradorList:
• Parallel display of the digitised original and the automatically read text
  • Line-by-line correspondence between the manuscript and the read text
  • Zoom and navigate within pages
  • Scroll within the document
  • Jump between pages
  • Search within the document
  • Download the minutes as PDF files and/or the read text
infoMiradorImageLegend:
HTR: Handwritten Text Recognition
OCR: Optical Character Recognition
infoData: The “Minutes of the Federal Council (1848–1963)” page includes more than 14,500 minutes of decisions. It comprises both the handwritten minutes from 1848 to 1903 and the typewritten minutes from 1904 to 1963.
infoHand:
The texts of over 8,000 handwritten minutes have been machine-read in cooperation with the Walter Benjamin Kolleg Digital Humanities at the University of Bern, using the Transkribus technology. Transkribus is an application from READ-COOP SCE for digitisation and AI-powered text recognition of handwritten documents.

Machine recognition of historical manuscripts is complex. The quality varies depending on the handwriting and language. The error rate for handwritten minutes is between 0.498% and 6.511% character errors, with an average of 3.35%.
infoMachine: The read text of typewritten decision minutes also exhibits text recognition errors, but the error rate is generally lower than with handwritten minutes.
searchResultsMatchingPassages: Found {{amount}} matching passages in the document.
searchIntroductionText: On the “Minutes of the Federal Council (1848–1963)” page, you can search both the handwritten and typewritten minutes of Federal Council decisions using search terms.
